Package com.wileyedge.fashiontrendanalysis.dao

Class UserDaoImplTest

java.lang.Object
com.wileyedge.fashiontrendanalysis.dao.UserDaoImplTest
@ExtendWith(org.mockito.junit.jupiter.MockitoExtension.class) public class UserDaoImplTest extends Object
This class provides unit tests for the UserDaoImpl class. It utilizes Mockito for mocking dependencies and JUnit5 for testing.

      @Test public void testCreateUser()
      Test case for creating a new user. It checks if the user is created and the correct ID is returned.

    • testFindByUsername

      Test case for finding a user by their username. It checks if the correct user details are returned.

      @Test public void testUpdateUser()
      Test case for updating user details. It checks if the user details are updated correctly.

    • testDeleteUser

      @Test public void testDeleteUser()
      Test case for deleting a user based on their ID. It checks if the user is deleted successfully.

    • testFindByNonExistentUsername

      @Test public void testFindByNonExistentUsername()
      Test case to handle scenarios where the requested user doesn't exist based on their username. It checks if the correct exception is thrown.

    • testDeleteNonExistentUser

      @Test public void testDeleteNonExistentUser()
      Test to handle scenarios where the requested user doesn't exist based on their ID. It checks if the correct boolean value is returned when attempting to delete a non-existent user.

    • testFindByEmail

      @Test public void testFindByEmail()
      Test to ensure a user can be fetched based on their email. It checks if the correct user details are returned when querying by email.

    • testFindByNonExistentEmail

      @Test public void testFindByNonExistentEmail()
      Test to handle scenarios where the requested user doesn't exist based on their email. It checks if the correct exception is thrown when querying with a non-existent email.

    • testFindById

      @Test public void testFindById()
      Test to ensure a user can be fetched based on their ID. It checks if the correct user details are returned when querying by ID.

    • testFindByNonExistentId

      @Test public void testFindByNonExistentId()
      Test to handle scenarios where the requested user doesn't exist based on their ID. It checks if the correct exception is thrown when querying with a non-existent ID.

    • testFindAll

      @Test public void testFindAll()
      Test to fetch all users from the database. It checks if a list of all users is returned correctly.
